cards.name: Svogthos, the Restless Tomb
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{3}{B}{G}: Until end of turn, Svogthos, the Restless Tomb becomes a black and green Plant Zombie creature with "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard." It's still a land.

rulings.text: While animated, Svogthos's power and toughness changes each time a creature card enters or leaves its controller's graveyard.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

foreignNames.name: 安息の無い墓、スヴォグトース

cards.originalText:

cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
Morph {2} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: Nothing lives within it, yet there is life.

rulings.text: When Zoetic Cavern is turned face up, any Auras on it that can't legally enchant it will be put into their owners' graveyards. Any Equipment will become unattached and remain on the battlefield. Any counters on it will remain on it.
If Blood Moon is on the battlefield and a player controls a face-down Zoetic Cavern, it can't be turned face up since it won't have a morph cost.

cards.name: Angel of Finality

Flying

cards.flavor: "Better the dead depart utterly than be enslaved."
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Angel of Finality enters the battlefield, exile all cards from target player's graveyard.

cards.name: Angelic Arbiter
cards.text:
Flying
Each opponent who cast a spell this turn can't attack with creatures.
Each opponent who attacked with a creature this turn can't cast spells.

rulings.text: During your turn, Angelic Arbiter's abilities have no effect on the game.

During an opponent's turn, that opponent may either cast spells or attack with creatures, but not both (assuming that Angelic Arbiter is on the battlefield for the entirety of that turn). The player may perform other actions, such as activating abilities and playing lands.

If Angelic Arbiter leaves the battlefield during an opponent's turn, its abilities cease to affect the game. For example, if an opponent casts Doom Blade to destroy Angelic Arbiter, that player may then attack with creatures.

If Angelic Arbiter enters the battlefield during an opponent's turn, its abilities take actions that player performed earlier in the turn into account, even though it wasn't on the battlefield at the time. For example, if an opponent casts a spell, then you use Leyline of Anticipation's ability to cast Angelic Arbiter as though it had flash, that player won't be able to attack with creatures that turn.
Angelic Arbiter's last ability applies if an opponent attacked with at least one creature during the current turn.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Each opponent who cast a spell this turn can't attack with creatures.
Each opponent who attacked with a creature this turn can't cast spells.

cards.name: Archangel of Strife
cards.text:
Flying
As Archangel of Strife enters the battlefield, each player chooses war or peace.
Creatures controlled by players who chose war get +3/+0.
Creatures controlled by players who chose peace get +0/+3.

rulings.text: Archangel of Strife's second and third abilities are linked. Similarly, its second and fourth abilities are linked. The bonus a player's creatures get depends only on the choice that player made when Archangel of Strife entered the battlefield.
The active player chooses war or peace first, followed by each other player in turn order. Each player will know what previous players chose when making their choice.
Archangel of Strife's bonuses apply immediately. Depending on your choice, Archangel of Strife will enter the battlefield as either a 9/6 or 6/9 creature.
If there are two Archangels of Strife on the battlefield, and you choose war for one and peace for the other, your creatures get +3/+3.
As soon as Archangel of Strife leaves the battlefield, the bonus stops applying. If it returns to the battlefield, players will be able to make new choices.

cards.originalText:
Flying
As Archangel of Strife enters the battlefield, each player chooses war or peace.
Creatures controlled by players who chose war get +3/+0.
Creatures controlled by players who chose peace get +0/+3.

cards.name: Bathe in Light
cards.text: Radiance — Choose a color. Target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Truth shines even in darkness. Those who march on the side of truth walk always in righteous light."

rulings.text: The color you choose as the spell resolves has nothing to do with the color or colors shared by the affected creatures.
All creatures that share a color are affected, even your own.

A creature "shares a color" with any creature that is at least one of its colors. For example, a green-white creature shares a color with creatures that are green, white, green-white, red-white, black-green, and so on.
If it targets a colorless creature, it doesn't affect any other creatures. A colorless creature shares a color with nothing, not even other colorless creatures.
You check which creatures share a color with the target when the spell resolves.
Only one creature is targeted. If that creature leaves the battlefield or otherwise becomes an illegal target, the entire spell doesn't resolve. No other creatures are affected.

cards.originalText: Radiance — Choose a color. Target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn.

cards.name: Congregate
cards.text: Target player gains 2 life for each creature on the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"In the gathering there is strength for all who founder, renewal for all who languish, love for all who sing."
—Song of All, canto 642

rulings.text: Creatures are counted during resolution.

cards.originalText: Target player gains 2 life for each creature on the battlefield.

cards.name: Curse of the Forsaken
cards.text:
Enchant player
Whenever a creature attacks enchanted player, its controller gains 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Purge the damned, for they have no place among the righteous!"
—Seeta of Thraben

rulings.text: A Curse spell targets the player it will enchant like any other Aura spell, and a Curse stays on the battlefield like any other Aura. If the enchanted player gains protection from the Curse's color (or any other characteristic the Curse has), the Curse will be put into its owner's graveyard.
Each of the Curses can be attached to any player, including the player who cast the Curse.
Curse is an enchantment type, not a creature type (or any other kind of subtype).
The ability won't trigger when a creature attacks a planeswalker controlled by the enchanted player.
The Curse subtype has no inherent rules meaning, but two cards in the Innistrad set (Bitterheart Witch and Witchbane Orb) refer to Curses.

cards.originalText:
Enchant player
Whenever a creature attacks enchanted player, its controller gains 1 life.

cards.name: Darksteel Mutation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature is an Insect artifact creature with base power and toughness 0/1 and has indestructible, and it loses all other abilities, card types, and creature types.
cards.flavor: Infinitely powerless.

rulings.text: Darksteel Mutation overwrites the printed power and toughness of the enchanted creature, as well as any characteristic-defining abilities that define power and/or toughness.

Darksteel Mutation overwrites any previous effects that set the enchanted creature's power or toughness to a specific value. Any such effects that start to apply after Darksteel Mutation entered the battlefield will work normally.

However, Darksteel Mutation does not overwrite effects that change the enchanted creature's power or toughness without setting it to a specific value (such as the ones created by Giant Growth or Glorious Anthem). It also won't overwrite the effect of counters.
The enchanted creature will be only an artifact and a creature, not any other card types. It will be only an Insect, not any other creature types.

In some rare cases, the creature may have subtypes other than creature types before becoming enchanted with Darksteel Mutation. If it had any other artifact subtypes (such as Equipment), it will retain those. If it had any subtypes other than artifact types and creature types (such as Shrine), it won't retain those.

The creature will keep any supertypes it previously had. Notably, if Darksteel Mutation is enchanting a legendary creature, that creature will continue to be legendary. Also, if it's enchanting a commander, that creature will continue to be a commander.
Darksteel Mutation doesn't affect the enchanted creature's colors, if any. It will continue to be whatever color or colors it was before Darksteel Mutation entered the battlefield.
Darksteel Mutation causes the enchanted creature to lose all abilities except indestructible at the time it becomes enchanted. Any abilities the creature gains after that point will work normally.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature is an Insect artifact creature with base power and toughness 0/1 and has indestructible, and it loses all other abilities, card types, and creature types.

cards.name: Fiend Hunter
cards.text:
When Fiend Hunter enters the battlefield, you may exile another target creature.
When Fiend Hunter leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

rulings.text: If Fiend Hunter leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its second ability will trigger and do nothing. Then its first ability will resolve and exile the targeted creature indefinitely.

Once the exiled permanent returns, it's considered a new object with no relation to the object that it was. Auras attached to the exiled permanent will be put into their owners' graveyards. Equipment attached to the exiled permanent will become unattached and remain on the battlefield. Any counters on the exiled permanent will cease to exist.
If a token is exiled this way, it won't return to the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
When Fiend Hunter enters the battlefield, you may exile another target creature.
When Fiend Hunter leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.name: Flickerform
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{2}{W}{W}: Exile enchanted creature and all Auras attached to it. At the beginning of the next end step, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control. If you do, return the other cards exiled this way to the battlefield under their owners' control attached to that creature.

rulings.text: The card that was enchanted comes back onto the battlefield first, regardless of whether it's still a creature. Then any Auras exiled that can legally enchant that card come back. Any Auras that can't enchant that permanent remain exiled.
If the enchanted creature was a token, it ceased to exist when it was exiled. Any Auras that were attached to it (including Flickerform) remain exiled.

If the enchanted creature was also enchanted by Copy Enchantment, Copy Enchantment will return to the battlefield attached to that permanent. As Copy Enchantment returns to the battlefield, its controller may choose any enchantment on the battlefield for it to copy. It can't copy Flickerform or any other Aura returning to the battlefield at the same time. If it copies a non-Aura enchantment, it returns to the battlefield unattached instead.
If the enchanted creature was enchanted by any Auras with bestow or any Licids, those cards will return to the battlefield unattached as creatures.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
{2}{W}{W}: Exile enchanted creature and all Auras attached to it. At the beginning of the next end step, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control. If you do, return the other cards exiled this way to the battlefield under their owners' control attached to that creature.

cards.name: Flickerwisp
cards.text:
Flying
When Flickerwisp enters the battlefield, exile another target permanent. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: Its wings disturb more than air.

rulings.text: The exiled card will return to the battlefield at the beginning of the end step even if Flickerwisp is no longer on the battlefield.
If the permanent that returns to the battlefield has any abilities that trigger at the beginning of the end step, those abilities won't trigger that turn.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Flickerwisp enters the battlefield, exile another target permanent. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

When Karmic Guide enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Kirtar's Wrath
cards.text:
Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
Threshold — If seven or more cards are in your graveyard, instead destroy all creatures, then create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying. Creatures destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText:
Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
Threshold — If seven or more cards are in your graveyard, instead destroy all creatures, then create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying. Creatures destroyed this way can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Lightkeeper of Emeria
cards.text:
Multikicker {W} (You may pay an additional {W} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Flying
When Lightkeeper of Emeria enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life for each time it was kicked.
cards.originalText:
Multikicker {W} (You may pay an additional {W} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Flying
When Lightkeeper of Emeria enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life for each time it was kicked.

cards.name: Mirror Entity
cards.text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
{X}: Until end of turn, creatures you control have base power and toughness X/X and gain all creature types.
cards.flavor: Unaware of Lorwyn's diversity, it sees only itself, reflected a thousand times over.

rulings.text: Activating the ability with X = 0 will cause all creatures you control to become 0/0 and be put into the graveyard.

Activating the ability for a second time in the same turn will overwrite the first activation. For example, if you activate the ability with X = 4, then activate it with X = 1, each of your creatures will be 1/1.

You apply power/toughness changing effects in a series of sublayers in the following order: (a) effects from characteristic-defining abilities; (b) effects that set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (c) effects that modify power and/or toughness but don't set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (d) changes from counters; (e) effects that switch a creature's power and toughness. This card's effect is always applied in (b), which means that effects applied in sublayer (c), (d), or (e) will not be overwritten; they will be applied to the new value.
Examples of creature types include Sliver, Goblin, and Soldier. Creature types appear after the dash on the type line of creatures.

cards.originalText:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
{X}: Until end of turn, creatures you control have base power and toughness X/X and gain all creature types.

cards.name: Mother of Runes
cards.text: {T}: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "My family protects all families."
cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Orim's Thunder
cards.text:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you cast this spell.)
Destroy target artifact or enchantment. If this spell was kicked, it deals damage equal to that permanent's converted mana cost to target creature.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you cast this spell.)
Destroy target artifact or enchantment. If Orim's Thunder was kicked, it deals damage equal to that permanent's converted mana cost to target creature.

cards.name: Path to Exile
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller may search their library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle their library.

rulings.text: If the targeted creature becomes an illegal target by the time Path to Exile would resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. The creature's controller won't search for a basic land card.
The controller of the exiled creature isn't required to search their library for a basic land. If that player doesn't, the player won't shuffle their library.

cards.originalText: Exile target creature. Its controller may search his or her library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle his or her library.

cards.name: Return to Dust
cards.text: Exile target artifact or enchantment. If you cast this spell during your main phase, you may exile up to one other target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: Some timelines forever fray, branch, and intermingle. Others end abruptly.

rulings.text: Regardless of when Return to Dust is cast, its controller may choose one target or two targets. It can always be cast even if there's only one legal target. If it's cast at a time other than its controller's main phase and a second target is chosen, nothing will happen to that target.

cards.originalText: Exile target artifact or enchantment. If you cast this spell during your main phase, you may exile up to one other target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Righteous Cause
cards.text: Whenever a creature attacks, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Until the world unites in vengeful fury and Phage is destroyed, I will not stay my hand."
—Akroma, angelic avenger
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature attacks, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor: Perfect justice in service of a perfect will.
cards.originalText: Flying, vigilance

cards.name: Shattered Angel
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a land enters the battlefield under an opponent's control, you may gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: She preaches the blessings of the Machine Orthodoxy.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a land enters the battlefield under an opponent's control, you may gain 3 life.

cards.name: Soul Snare
cards.text: {W}, Sacrifice Soul Snare: Exile target creature that's attacking you or a planeswalker you control.
cards.flavor:
"Body and spirit are sworn enemies. They will take any excuse to be rid of each other."
—Tariel, Reckoner of Souls
cards.originalText: {W}, Sacrifice Soul Snare: Exile target creature that's attacking you or a planeswalker you control.

cards.name: Stonecloaker
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
When Stonecloaker enters the battlefield, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
When Stonecloaker enters the battlefield, exile target card from a graveyard.

rulings.text: Both triggered abilities trigger when Stonecloaker enters the battlefield. They can be put on the stack in either order.
You may return this creature itself to its owner's hand as its triggered ability resolves. If you don't control enough other creatures, you must return it.
The ability doesn't target any creature. You don't choose what to return until the ability resolves. Once the ability has started to resolve, no one can respond to the choice.

cards.originalText:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
When Stonecloaker enters the battlefield, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
When Stonecloaker enters the battlefield, exile target card from a graveyard.

cards.name: Tempt with Glory
cards.text: Tempting offer — Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control. Each opponent may put a +1/+1 counter on each creature they control. For each opponent who does, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

rulings.text: Your opponents decide in turn order whether or not they accept the offer, starting with the opponent on your left. Each opponent will know the decisions of previous opponents in turn order when making their decision.

After each opponent has decided, the effect happens simultaneously for each one who accepted the offer. Then, the effect happens again for you a number of times equal to the number of opponents who accepted.

cards.originalText: Tempting offer — Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control. Each opponent may put a +1/+1 counter on each creature he or she controls. For each opponent who does, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

cards.name: Unexpectedly Absent
cards.text: Put target nonland permanent into its owner's library just beneath the top X cards of that library.
cards.flavor: Once you've been dragged down the currents of time, you'll never quite trust your own permanence again.

rulings.text: If there are fewer than X cards in that player's library, put that permanent on the bottom of that library.
If you choose 0 as the value for X, put that permanent on top of its owner's library.

cards.originalText: Put target nonland permanent into its owner's library just beneath the top X cards of that library.

cards.text:
Flying
As Voice of All enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Voice of All has protection from the chosen color.
cards.originalText:
Flying
As Voice of All enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Voice of All has protection from the chosen color.

cards.name: Vow of Duty
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2, has vigilance, and can't attack you or a planeswalker you control.
cards.flavor:
"I prefer loyalty to be a matter of respect, not of magic. But one does what one must."
—Kaalia of the Vast
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2, has vigilance, and can't attack you or a planeswalker you control.

cards.name: Arcane Denial
cards.text:
Counter target spell. Its controller may draw up to two cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
You draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

rulings.text: The controller of the countered spell doesn't choose how many cards to draw until the relevant ability resolves. The player may draw 0, 1, or 2 cards. They choose the number before drawing any cards.

cards.originalText:
Counter target spell. Its controller may draw up to two cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
You draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Azami, Lady of Scrolls
cards.text: Tap an untapped Wizard you control: Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Choices belong to those with the luxuries of time and distance. We have neither. I recommend we proceed with the plan to destroy all shrines of the kami."
—Lady Azami, letter to Sensei Hisoka
cards.originalText: Tap an untapped Wizard you control: Draw a card.

cards.name: Blue Sun's Zenith
cards.text: Target player draws X cards. Shuffle Blue Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"The Origin Query will wait. We must ensure we survive to return to it."
—Pelyus, vedalken ordinar

rulings.text: If this spell doesn't resolve, none of its effects occur. In particular, it will go to the graveyard rather than to its owner's library.
Because you follow the spell's instructions in order, you won't be able to draw the same Blue Sun's Zenith that you cast.

cards.originalText: Target player draws X cards. Shuffle Blue Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.

cards.name: Borrowing 100,000 Arrows
cards.text: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.
cards.flavor: Kongming and Lu Su tricked Wei troops into shooting over 100,000 arrows at them to later use against the Wei at Red Cliffs.
cards.originalText: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.

cards.name: Control Magic
cards.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"Do as I think, not as I do."
—Jace Beleren

rulings.text: Gaining control of a creature doesn't cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.

cards.name: Curse of Inertia
cards.text:
Enchant player
Whenever a player attacks enchanted player with one or more creatures, that attacking player may tap or untap target permanent of their choice.
cards.flavor:
"As long as I pull the strings, you will dance."
—Tezzeret

rulings.text: A Curse spell targets the player it will enchant like any other Aura spell, and a Curse stays on the battlefield like any other Aura. If the enchanted player gains protection from the Curse's color (or any other characteristic the Curse has), the Curse will be put into its owner's graveyard.
Each of the Curses can be attached to any player, including the player who cast the Curse.
Curse is an enchantment type, not a creature type (or any other kind of subtype).
The ability won't trigger when a creature attacks a planeswalker controlled by the enchanted player.
The Curse subtype has no inherent rules meaning, but two cards in the Innistrad set (Bitterheart Witch and Witchbane Orb) refer to Curses.
Curse of Inertia's ability will trigger only once per attacking player per combat phase, no matter how many creatures that player attacks with.

Even though the attacking player chooses the target of the ability, the ability is still controlled by the player who controls Curse of Inertia. Notably, a creature with hexproof controlled by the player who controls Curse of Inertia could be chosen, even though another player may be choosing the target.

cards.originalText:
Enchant player
Whenever a player attacks enchanted player with one or more creatures, that attacking player may tap or untap target permanent of his or her choice.

cards.name: Deceiver Exarch
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Deceiver Exarch enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Untap target permanent you control.
• Tap target permanent an opponent controls.
cards.originalText:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Deceiver Exarch enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Untap target permanent you control.
• Tap target permanent an opponent controls.

cards.name: Diviner Spirit
cards.text: Whenever Diviner Spirit deals combat damage to a player, you and that player each draw that many cards.
cards.flavor: Sentience is its natural habitat.

rulings.text: If Diviner Spirit deals combat damage to its controller (perhaps because damage was redirected), that player will draw twice that number of cards.

cards.originalText: Whenever Diviner Spirit deals combat damage to a player, you and that player each draw that many cards.

cards.name: Djinn of Infinite Deceits
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Exchange control of two target nonlegendary creatures. You can't activate this ability during combat.
cards.flavor: The winds of change have a mind of their own.

rulings.text: You don't have to control either target.
If the same player controls both creatures when the ability resolves, nothing happens.
If one of the creatures is an illegal target when the ability resolves, the exchange won't happen. If both creatures are illegal targets, the ability won't resolve.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Exchange control of two target nonlegendary creatures. You can't activate this ability during combat.

cards.name: Dungeon Geists
cards.text:
Flying
When Dungeon Geists enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as you control Dungeon Geists.

rulings.text: If another player gains control of Dungeon Geists, the creature will no longer be affected by the ability preventing it from untapping, even if you later regain control of Dungeon Geists.
If you gain control of the creature that's being prevented from untapping, that creature won't untap during your untap step for as long as you control Dungeon Geists.
The ability can target a tapped creature. If the targeted creature is already tapped when it resolves, that creature just remains tapped and doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Dungeon Geists enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as you control Dungeon Geists.

cards.name: Hada Spy Patrol
cards.text:
Level up {2}{U} ({2}{U}: Put a level counter on this. Level up only as a sorcery.)
LEVEL 1-2
2/2
Hada Spy Patrol can't be blocked.
LEVEL 3+
3/3
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Hada Spy Patrol can't be blocked.

rulings.text: The abilities a leveler grants to itself don't overwrite any other abilities it may have. In particular, they don't overwrite the creature's level up ability; it always has that.

Effects that set a leveler's power or toughness to a specific value, including the effects from a level symbol's ability, apply in timestamp order. The timestamp of each level symbol's ability is the same as the timestamp of the leveler itself, regardless of when the most recent level counter was put on it.

Effects that modify a leveler's power or toughness, such as the effects of Giant Growth or Glorious Anthem, will apply to it no matter when they started to take effect. The same is true for counters that change the creature's power or toughness (such as +1/+1 counters) and effects that switch its power and toughness.

If another creature becomes a copy of a leveler, all of the leveler's printed abilities — including those represented by level symbols — are copied. The current characteristics of the leveler, and the number of level counters on it, are not. The abilities, power, and toughness of the copy will be determined based on how many level counters are on the copy.

A creature's level is based on how many level counters it has on it, not how many times its level up ability has been activated or has resolved. If a leveler gets level counters due to some other effect (such as Clockspinning) or loses level counters for some reason (such as Vampire Hexmage), its level is changed accordingly.

cards.originalText:
Level up {2}{U} ({2}{U}: Put a level counter on this. Level up only as a sorcery.)
LEVEL 1-2
2/2
Hada Spy Patrol can't be blocked.
LEVEL 3+
3/3
Shroud
Hada Spy Patrol can't be blocked.

cards.name: Lu Xun, Scholar General
cards.text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
Whenever Lu Xun, Scholar General deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.
Lu Xun's second ability triggers whenever it deals damage to an opponent for any reason. It's not limited to combat damage.

cards.originalText:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
Whenever Lu Xun, Scholar General deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Thornwind Faeries
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Thornwind Faeries deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Guarding the ship is the Thornwinds' first concern. Getting along with the locals ranks fourth or fifth at best.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Thornwind Faeries deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Wash Out
cards.text: Return all permanents of the color of your choice to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor:
"It's not the darkness I fear but dull and numbing shades of gray."
—Sydri, galvanic genius
cards.originalText: Return all permanents of the color of your choice to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Wonder
cards.text:
Flying
As long as Wonder is in your graveyard and you control an Island, creatures you control have flying.
cards.flavor:
"The awestruck birds gazed at Wonder. Slowly, timidly, they rose into the air."
—Scroll of Beginnings
cards.originalText:
Flying
As long as Wonder is in your graveyard and you control an Island, creatures you control have flying.

cards.name: Altar's Reap
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Draw two cards.
cards.flavor:
"Don't worry, your death will be as informative as possible."
—Gorghul, augur of skulls

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Altar's Reap, sacrifice a creature.
Draw two cards.

cards.name: Ambition's Cost
cards.text: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.
cards.flavor: The waters of wisdom are as dust in the mouth of one who thirsts for power.
cards.originalText: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.

cards.name: Banshee of the Dread Choir
cards.text:
Myriad (Whenever this creature attacks, for each opponent other than defending player, you may create a token that's a copy of this creature that's tapped and attacking that player or a planeswalker they control. Exile the tokens at end of combat.)
Whenever Banshee of the Dread Choir deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.

rulings.text: The term "defending player" in the myriad rules (or any other ability of an attacking creature) refers to the player the creature with myriad was attacking at the time it became an attacking creature this combat, or the controller of the planeswalker the creature was attacking at the time it became an attacking creature this combat.
If the defending player is your only opponent, no tokens are put onto the battlefield.
You choose whether each token is attacking the player or a planeswalker they control as the token is created.

Although the tokens enter the battlefield attacking, they were never declared as attackers. Abilities that trigger whenever a creature attacks won't trigger, including the myriad ability of the tokens. If there any costs to have a creature attack, those costs won't apply to the tokens.
The token creatures all enter the battlefield at the same time.

Each token copies exactly what was printed on the original creature and nothing else. It doesn't copy whether that creature is tapped or untapped, whether it has any counters on it or Auras and Equipment attached to it, or any non-copy effects that have changed its power, toughness, types, color, and so on.

Any enters-the-battlefield abilities of the copied creature will trigger when the token enters the battlefield. Any "as [this permanent] enters the battlefield" or "[this permanent] enters the battlefield with" abilities of the copied creature will also work.

If myriad creates more than one token for any given player (due to an effect such as the one Doubling Season creates), you may choose separately for each token whether it's attacking the player or a planeswalker they control.

cards.originalText:
Myriad (Whenever this creature attacks, for each opponent other than defending player, you may create a token that's a copy of this creature that's tapped and attacking that player or a planeswalker he or she controls. Exile the tokens at end of combat.)
Whenever Banshee of the Dread Choir deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.

cards.name: Barter in Blood
cards.text: Each player sacrifices two creatures.
cards.flavor:
"We must all make sacrifices for the good of Innistrad."
—Sorin Markov

rulings.text: The active player chooses which creatures will be sacrificed first, then each other player in turn order does the same. Then all creatures are sacrificed simultaneously.
If a player controls only one creature, that creature is sacrificed.
Barter in Blood doesn't target any creatures and may be cast even if a player controls fewer than two creatures.

cards.originalText: Each player sacrifices two creatures.

cards.name: Blood Bairn
cards.text: Sacrifice another creature: Blood Bairn gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The travelers were warned to watch out for children on the road.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice another creature: Blood Bairn gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Butcher of Malakir
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Butcher of Malakir or another creature you control dies, each opponent sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor: His verdict is always guilty. His sentence is always death.

rulings.text: When the triggered ability resolves, first the player whose turn it is (if that player is an opponent) chooses which creature they will sacrifice, then each other opponent in turn order does the same, then all chosen creatures are sacrificed at the same time.

If multiple creatures you control (possibly including Butcher of Malakir itself) are put into their owners' graveyards at the same time, Butcher of Malakir's triggered ability will trigger that many times.

If you control more than one Butcher of Malakir and a creature you control is put into a graveyard, each of those Butchers' abilities will trigger. Each opponent will sacrifice a creature each time one of those abilities resolves.

If you and an opponent each control a Butcher of Malakir and a creature is put into a graveyard, a chain reaction happens. First the ability of one player's Butcher will trigger, causing each opponent to sacrifice a creature. That sacrifice causes the ability of the other player's Butcher to trigger, and so on.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Butcher of Malakir or another creature you control dies, each opponent sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Champion of Stray Souls
cards.text:
{3}{B}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice X other creatures: Return X target creature cards from your graveyard to the battlefield.
{5}{B}{B}: Put Champion of Stray Souls on top of your library from your graveyard.

rulings.text: You choose the targets of the first ability as you activate that ability, before you pay any costs. You can't target any of the creatures you sacrifice.
The last ability can be activated only if Champion of Stray Souls is in your graveyard.

cards.originalText:
{3}{B}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice X other creatures: Return X target creature cards from your graveyard to the battlefield.
{5}{B}{B}: Put Champion of Stray Souls on top of your library from your graveyard.
